intro: Melosperma andicola, commonly known as the Andean melonweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a distinctive pubescent surface. Melosperma andicola is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
